image.altText: Dan Cregan speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: South Australian Police Minister Dan Cregan is quitting state cabinet, citing "pressing family matters", triggering a reshuffle ahead of his retirement from politics at the next election.

title.children: SA minister quits cabinet ahead of retirement from politics

image.altText: A stethoscope on a white surface

props.synopsis: South Australian general practitioner Hemant Kumar Vanmali began an inappropriate relationship with a patient, who was aged in her 80s, "almost immediately" after her last consultation.

title.children: Doctor suspended over inappropriate relationship with elderly patient

image.altText: Big black cockie with white marking on tail, perched on gum tree branch, holding a feather

props.synopsis: The deadly Wangary bushfire 20 years ago appears to have been the final nail in the coffin for yellow-tailed black cockatoos in South Australia's Eyre Peninsula. Ecologists are calling for urgent action before it's too late.

title.children: Help needed to save the last cockatoos restricted to this region

image.altText: A man wearing black rimmed glasses, black suit and yellow tie stands in front of a group of media microphones speaking.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says "there is no place for this hateful ideology here in Australia" following the arrest of 16 National Socialist Network members on Sunday.

title.children: PM condemns 'horrific scenes' of neo-Nazi gathering in Adelaide

image.altText: Asian-looking smiling man, light suit, and woman, short hair, dark suit, tie, earrings, sit in front of  haystack, arm in arm.

props.synopsis: Julie Mar says she has sometimes gone without buying groceries to fund her husband's partner visa. A solicitor says the application process can cost upwards of $9,000.

title.children: Married couple wait three years for partner visa

image.altText: aerial shot of Adelaide's water desalination plant

props.synopsis: Desalination production south of Adelaide is set to quadruple as local reservoirs fall to 44 per cent capacity, with dry conditions causing the lowest inflows in over 40 years.

title.children: Desalination plant to 'ramp up' as reservoir levels drop to 20-year low

image.altText: A beached beaked whale near a river

props.synopsis: A wildlife ranger says the discovery of a beached whale, believed to be a beaked whale, on South Australia's Kangaroo Island is a "peculiar" occurrence.

title.children: 'Elusive deep-water' whale found beached on Kangaroo Island

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old woman is airlifted to hospital after she was struck by a boat allegedly being operated by a woman with a blood alcohol concentration nearly three times the legal limit.

title.children: Swimmer airlifted to hospital after being struck by boat on River Murray

props.synopsis: A shortage of qualified instructors has made adult swimming lessons harder to find despite a rise in drownings.

title.children: 'Alarming' number of adults can't swim, but lessons are hard to find

image.altText: A variety of rubbish, including a swing set, dumped on a brown forest floor, with green trees behind

props.synopsis: Forestry companies say a rise in rubbish dumping increases fire hazards in an already high-risk summer, and it is costing them thousands of dollars to clean up.

title.children: Lack of education blamed for rubbish being dumped in forests

image.altText: woman looking out window

props.synopsis: There’s a push for stricter regulation of the massage industry, after a practitioner was able to keep indecently assaulting his clients after being reported to police and an industry body. Data shows the issue could be widespread.

title.children: The massage industry is self-regulated. These women want that to change

image.altText: An elephant inside a cage with a zookeeper standing outside

props.synopsis: Perth Zoo's last remaining female elephant, Permai, is on the road to her forever home at South Australia's Monarto Safari Park.

title.children: Sadness as 'unique' Perth Zoo elephant leaves for new life in South Australia

image.altText: A woman holding a small jar filled with white vitamins.

props.synopsis: Pressure is mounting on Australia's medicines regulator to tighten restrictions around vitamin B6 supplements, with more cases of people inadvertently poisoning themselves emerging.

title.children: CEOs, musicians and doctors all victims of B6 toxicity

image.altText: A corrugated rain tank on a stand near a windmill with the bush and grass illuminated red by a fire at night.

props.synopsis: An accommodation and wedding venue in Victoria's west has been destroyed by a bushfire. The blaze has burnt through 65,000 hectares of land.

title.children: Victorian bushfire burns 65,000 hectares in a day, destroying lodge

image.altText: An illustration of a finger tapping on a phone screen with a large padlock being shown on it.

props.synopsis: The ABC analysed 29 million stolen codes to help you avoid using an insecure one.

title.children: We looked at millions of stolen PINs and found the absolute worst one

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos, Sundar Pichai and Elon Musk standing on a stage

props.synopsis: While all the focus during US President Donald Trump's inauguration was on tariffs, the sight of four tech titans at the ceremony should have put another economic policy on the radar: Tax.

title.children: Trump's powerful new allies don't much like Australia

image.altText: Telstra logo, optus logo and ACMA logo with a man holding a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: The telecommunications regulator cut a deal with Optus behind closed doors that reduced the potential financial penalty it was facing for committing serious public safety breaches, documents released to the ABC have revealed.

title.children: Emails reveal 'inappropriate' dealings between regulator and Optus, Telstra

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton stand next to each other.

props.synopsis: Australians could head to the polls in a federal election within months. So when will it be and what are the key seats in the battle to lead the country?

title.children: The states that will decide the next federal election

image.altText: Fatima Payman

props.synopsis: Ex-Labor senator Fatima Payman says Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has been "petty" in delaying approval of additional staff for her office, more than six months after she quit the party.

title.children: Fatima Payman says Anthony Albanese withholding staff in 'petty games'

image.altText: Air conditioner units on the exterior of a hospital.

props.synopsis: Over the past 30 years, a technology we barely notice has quietly shaped where and how Australians live. But our love of 'manufactured air' also comes at a cost.

title.children: Air conditioning quietly changed Australian life in just a few decades

image.altText: Aerial shot of rows of white battery containers in the foreground and coal plant/cooling tower in background

props.synopsis: In Western Australia, the world's largest island grid is taking a huge bet, and carrying out a major experiment, on the role of batteries in the energy transition.

title.children: In the world's largest isolated grid, a big bet is being placed on giant batteries

image.altText: A man in suit gestures at a podium with flags in the background.

props.synopsis: The treasurer is quick to downplay speculation the government could be in striking distance of a third budget surplus. Follow live.

title.children: Treasurer pours cold water on hopes for a third surplus

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Chalmers downplays speculation of a shock third suprlus
Chalmers says job's not done even if inflation figures are within target
Should roads funding be tied to safety score?

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: mitchell owen

props.synopsis: An inspired Mitchell Owen produces the equal-fastest ever Big Bash century to lift the Hobart Hurricanes a maiden BBL title with victory over the Sydney Thunder at Bellerive Oval.

title.children: Mitchell Owen supreme as Hobart Hurricanes win maiden BBL crown

image.altText: A man saluting

props.synopsis: Prabowo Subianto has long dreamed of being Indonesia's president. Here's how he spent his first 100 days in the job.

title.children: In Indonesia, Prabowo's first 100 days in power have been full of surprises

image.altText: A boy with his mother aboard a cart pulled by a horse

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of Palestinians streamed along main roads, jubilant to be returning home after months of living in temporary shelter but fearing what might remain of their homes.

title.children: Emotional scenes as Palestinians head home to northern Gaza

image.altText: A gold $1 Australian coin in the centre, surrounded by other coins

props.synopsis: The weaker Australian dollar is welcome news for businesses that export to countries like the US, but the lower currency can be a drain on travellers' budgets and hit import businesses.

title.children: The Australian dollar faces a Trump tariff stress test

image.altText: an ID photo superimposed on a photo of a pile of loose tobacco

props.synopsis: Queensland's crime watchdog has wielded controversial confiscation laws against alleged sellers of illicit tobacco for the first time.

title.children: Tobacco raids, frozen assets and the ex-Iraqi intelligence agent

image.altText: Yimin Qiang smiling under a tree

props.synopsis: For some women, it's an easy decision to keep their surnames after marriage — and it's not just because of their culture.

title.children: Married surnames are a complicated issue for some women

image.altText: Alexander Lukashenko

props.synopsis: Alexander Lukashenko, who has ruled the ex-Soviet state for 31 years, held a four-hour press conference musing that some of his opponents "chose prison", after winning 88 per cent of the vote.

title.children: 'Only' 88 percent: Election of Belarus president rejected as 'sham'

image.altText: writing on a brick painted white

props.synopsis: Construction workers uncovered the message and went on a mission to track down the family of the man who left it there.

title.children: 65-year-old hidden message uncovered in roof of Old Parliament House

image.altText: Smiling group of Chinese men and women on a boat, some have arms raised in sky, some make victory sign, ocean behind.

props.synopsis: Nearly 18 months since the Chinese tourism market reopened to Australia, annual visitor numbers to Queensland’s Gold Coast remain down by almost 75 per cent compared with pre-COVID figures.

title.children: Slow return of big-spending Chinese tourists worries industry

image.altText: Ley speaking at a pulpit.

props.synopsis: The prime minister claims deputy Liberal leader Sussan Ley disrespected Indigenous people with an analogy comparing the First Fleet to Elon Musk's mission to Mars.

title.children: 'Strange': PM says Ley's Musk analogy disrespected Indigenous Australians

image.altText: A close up of the Colombian consulate sign with a flag in the background

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump and Colombian President Gustavo Petro clash with fiery social media posts. But what about the people caught up in the diplomatic stoush?

title.children: What happens to the Colombians being deported from the US?
